tags.tag:
The a tag defines an anchor element. An anchor can be used in two ways:
To create a link to another document by using the href attribute To create a bookmark inside a document, by using the name or id attribute
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the character encoding of the target URL
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the coordinates appropriate to the shape attribute to define a region of an image for image maps
The target URL of the link
The target URL of the link
Specifies what media/device the target URL is optimized for.
Use only if the href attribute is present. Default value: all.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Names an anchor. Use this attribute to create a bookmark in a document. In future versions of XHTML the name attribute will be replaced by the id attribute!!
Space separated list of URL's that gets notified when a user follows the hyperlink. Use only if the href attribute is present
Specifies the relationship between the current document and the target URL
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the relationship between the target URL and the current document
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines the type of region to be defined for mapping in the current area tag. Used with the coords attribute.
Defines the type of region to be defined for mapping in the current area tag. Used with the coords attribute.
Specifies the MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) type of the target URL
&core; ⟨ &keyboard; &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

Defines a region in an image map.
Specifies an alternate text for the area
Specifies the coordinates for the clickable area
Specifies the target URL of the area
Specifies the base language of the target URL. Use only if the href attribute is present.
Specifies the mediatype of the target URL.
Default value: all.
Use only if the href attribute is present.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Excludes an area from the image map
&value_boolean;
Space separated list of URL's that gets notified when a user follows the hyperlink.
Use only if the href attribute is present.
Specifies the relationship between the current document and the target URL
Defines the shape of the area
Where to open the target URL.
Specifies the MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) type of the target URL
&core; ⟨ &keyboard; &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

tag.name: base
tag.help: Specifies a base URL for all the links in a page. * In HTML the tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the tag must be properly closed.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: Specifies the URL to use as the base URL for links in the page

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Where to open all the links on the page. This attribute can be overridden by using the target attribute in each link.

tags.tag:
The body element defines the documents' body. All "presentation attributes" of the body element were deprecated in HTML 4.01.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the color of the active links in the document. Deprecated. Use styles instead.
Not supported in HTML 5.
An image to use as the background. Deprecated. Use styles instead.
Not supported in HTML 5.
The background color of the document. Deprecated. Use styles instead.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the color of all the links in the document. Deprecated. Use styles instead.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the color of the text in the document. Deprecated. Use styles instead.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the color of the visited links in the document. Deprecated. Use styles instead.
&core; ⟨ &event_window; &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

Inserts a single line break. * In HTML the tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the tag must be properly closed
&core;

Defines a command button, like a radiobutton, a checkbox, or a button.
The command element must be inside a menu element. If not, it will not be displayed.
Defines if the command is checked or not.
Use only if type is radio or checkbox
Defines if the command is available or not
Defines the url of an image to display as the command
Defines a name for the command. The label is visible
Defines the name of the radiogroup this command belongs to.
Use only if type is radio.
Defines the type of command.
Default value is command.
&core; ⟨ &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

Creates a form for client input
Not supported in HTML 5.
A comma separated list of content types that the server that process this form will handle correctly
A comma separated list of possible character sets for the form data. The default value is "unknown"
A URL that defines where to send the data when the submit button is pushed
If "on" browsers can store the form's input values, to auto-fill the form if the user returns to the page.
If "off" browsers should not store this information.
The mime type used to encode the content of the form
The HTTP method for sending data to the action URL. Default is get.
Defines a unique name for the form
If present the form should not be validated when submitted.
Where to open the target URL.
&core; ⟨ &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

The head element can contain information about the document.
Not supported in HTML 5.
A space separated list of URL's that contains meta data information about the page
⟨

This element tells a browser that this is an HTML document. The xmlns attribute is required in XHTML but not in HTML. (http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml)
Defines an URL, at this URL the document's cache information is being described.
Defines the XML namespace attribute
⟨

Creates an inline frame that contains another document.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies whether or not to display a frame border
Defines the height of the iframe
Not supported in HTML 5.
A URL to a long description of the frame contents
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines the top and bottom margins of the iframe
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines the left and right margins of the iframe
Specifies a unique name of the iframe (to use in scripts)
Defines restrictions to the frame content.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Define scroll bars
If present, the iframe should appear as if it is part of the document the iframe is in.
The URL of the document to show in the iframe
The HTML of the document showing in the iframe
Defines the width of the iframe
&core; ⟨ &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

The img element defines an image. * In HTML the tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the tag must be properly closed.
Defines a short description of the image
The URL of the image to display
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines a border around an image. Deprecated. Use styles instead
Defines the height of the image
Defines the image as a server-side image map
A URL to a document that contains a long description of the image
Defines the image as a client-side image map.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines white space on the left and right side of the image. Deprecated. Use styles instead
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines white space on the top and bottom of the image. Deprecated. Use styles instead
Defines the width of the image
&align; &core; ⟨ &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

Defines the start of an input field where the client can enter data. * In HTML the input tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the input tag must be properly closed.
A comma-separated list of MIME types that indicates the MIME type of the file transfer.
Defines an alternate text for the image.
If "on" browsers can store the form's input values, to auto-fill the form if the user returns to the page.
If "off" browsers should not store this information.
Makes the input field focused on page load
Cannot be used with type="hidden"
Indicates that the input element should be checked when it first loads.
&value_boolean;
Disables the input element when it first loads so that the user can not write text in it, or select it.
&value_boolean;
Defines one or more forms the input field belongs to.
Overrides the form's action attribute. Must be a valid URL that defines where to send the data when the form is submitted
Specifies how form-data should be encoded before sending it to a server. Overrides the form's enctype attribute.
Specifies how to send form-data. Overrides the form's action attribute.
If present, indicates that the form should not be validated when submitted.
Overrides the form's novalidate attribute.
Specifies where to open the action URL. Overrides the forms target attribute.
Defines the height of the input
Reference to a datalist element. If defined, a suggestion list (drop down list?) should be displayed, with predefined opions.
The input field's maximum value.
Use togheter with the "min" attribute to create a range of legal values.
Defines the maximum number of characters allowed in a text field.
The input field's minimum value.
Use togheter with the "max" attribute to create a range of legal values.
Defines a unique name for the input element.
Defines a pattern or format for the input field's value.
Defines a hint to help users fill out the input field.
Indicates that the value of this field cannot be modified.
Defines if the input field's value is required in order to submit the form
Cannot be used with type: hidden, image, button, submit, reset
Defines the size of the input element.
Defines the URL of the image to display.
Allowed when type=date, datetime, datetime-local, month, week, time, number, or range.
The class of the element
For buttons: Defines the text on the button.
For image buttons: Defines the symbolic result of the field passed to a script.
For checkboxes and radio buttons: Defines the result of the input element when clicked. The result is sent to the form's action URL.
For hidden, password, and text fields: Defines the default value of the element.
Cannot be used with type="file"
This attribute is required with type="checkbox" and type="radio"
Defines the width of the input
&align; &core; ⟨ &keyboard; &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

This element defines the relationship between two linked documents. * In HTML tag has no end tag. * In XHTML tag must be properly closed.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines the character encoding of the target URL. Default value is "ISO-8859-1"
The target URL of the resource
Defines the base language of the target URL
Specifies on what device the document will be displayed
Defines the relationship between the current document and the targeted document
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines the relationship between the targeted document and the current document
Defines sizes of the linked resource.
Can be used when rel="icon".
Not supported in HTML 5.
Where to open the target URL.
Specifies the MIME type of the target URL
&core; ⟨ &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

The element provides meta-information about your page, such as descriptions and keywords for search engines and refresh rates.
Specifies the character encoding for the document
Defines meta information to be associated with http-equiv or name
Connects the content attribute to an HTTP header
Connects the content attribute to a name
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines a format to be used to interpret the value of the content attribute
⟨

Used to define an alternate content (text) if a script is NOT executed.
The class of the element
&core; ⟨

Defines an embedded object. Use this element to add multimedia to your XHTML page.
Not supported in HTML 5.
A space separated list of URL's to archives. The archives contains resources relevant to the object
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines a border around the object
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines a class ID value as set in the Windows Registry or a URL
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines where to find the code for the object
Not supported in HTML 5.
The internet media type of the code referred to by the classid attribute
Defines a URL that refers to the object's data
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines that the object should only be declared, not created or instantiated until needed
&value_boolean;
Defines one ore more forms the object belongs to.
Defines the height of the object
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines the horizontal spacing around the object
Defines a unique name for the object (to use in scripts)
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines a text to display while the object is loading
Defines the MIME type of data specified in the data attribute
Specifies a URL of a client-side image map to be used with the object
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines the vertical spacing around the object
Defines the width of the object
&align; &core; ⟨ &keyboard; &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

tag.name: script
tag.help: Defines a script, such as a JavaScript. The "language" attribute of the script element was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: async
parameter.help: Defines if the script should be executed asynchronously or not

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Indicates the MIME type of the script

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help: Defines the character encoding used in script

parameter.name: defer
parameter.help: Indicates that the script is not going to generate any document content.

parameter.name: language
parameter.help: Specifies the scripting language. Deprecated. Use the type attribute instead.

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: Defines a URL to a file that contains the script

tags.tag:
Defines a style in a document.
If the scoped attribute is NOT defined, the <style> element must be placed in the <head> section.
The destination medium for the style information
If present, the styles should ONLY apply to the style elements parent element and its child elements.
Defines the content-type
⟨

Defines a table. Inside a table tag you can put table headers, table rows, table cells, and other tables.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the border width.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the space between the cell walls and contents
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the space between cells
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies how the outer borders should be displayed. Note: Must be used in conjunction with the "border" attribute
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the horizontal/vertical divider lines. Note: Must be used in conjunction with the "border" attribute
Specifies a summary of the table for speech-synthesizing/ non-visual browsers
&size; &align; &core; ⟨ &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

Defines a cell in a table.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies an abbreviated version of the content in a cell
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines a name for a cell
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies which character to align text on. Note: Only used if align="char"!
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the alignment offset to the first character to align on. Note: Only used if align="char"!
Indicates the number of columns this cell should span
A space-separated list of cell IDs that supply header information for the cell. This attribute allows text-only browsers to render the header information for a given cell
Not supported in HTML 5.
Whether to disable or enable automatic text wrapping in this cell. Deprecated. Use styles instead.
&value_boolean;
Indicates the number of rows this cell should span
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies if this cell provides header information for the rest of the row that contains it
&align; &valign; &size; &core; ⟨ &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

Defines a text-area (a multi-line text input control).
Makes the textarea focused on page load.
Specifies the number of rows visible in the text-area
Disables the text-area when it is first displayed
Defines one ore more forms the textarea belongs to.
Defines the maximum number of characters allowed in the textarea.
Specifies a name for the text-area
Defines a hint to help users fill out the textarea.
Indicates that the user cannot modify the content in the text-area
Defines if the textarea's value is required in order to submit the form.
Specifies the number of columns visible in the text-area
Specifies how to wrap the textarea's content when submitted.
If the value is "hard" then line breaks are added at the "cols" attribute's value.
The value "soft" is default, and adds no line breaks.
&core; ⟨ &keyboard; &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

Defines a table header cell in a table. The text within the th element usually renders in bold.
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies an abbreviated version of the content in a cell
Not supported in HTML 5.
Defines a name for a cell
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies which character to align text on. Note: Only used if align="char"!
Not supported in HTML 5.
Specifies the alignment offset to the first character to align on. Note: Only used if align="char"!
Indicates the number of columns this cell should span
A space-separated list of cell IDs that supply header information for the cell. This attribute allows text-only browsers to render the header information for a given cell
Not supported in HTML 5.
Whether to disable or enable automatic text wrapping in this cell. Deprecated. Use styles instead.
&value_boolean;
Indicates the number of rows this cell should span
Specifies if this cell provides header information for the rest of the row that contains it
&align; &valign; &size; &core; ⟨ &event_form; &event_keyboard; &event_mouse; &event_media;

This element defines the title of the document.
The class of the element
A unique id for the element
An inline style definition
&core; ⟨

Defines a base font. Deprecated in HTML 4.01.
Specifies the text color. Deprecated. Use styles instead.
Specifies the font to use. Deprecated. Use styles instead
Font size for font elements. Deprecated. Use styles instead.
&core; ⟨

Specifies the font face, font size, and font color of text. The font element was deprecated in HTML 4.01.
Defines the color of the text in the font element. Deprecated. Use styles instead
Defines the font of the text in the font element. Deprecated. Use styles instead
Defines the size of the text in the font element. Deprecated. Use styles instead
&core; ⟨

Defines a sub window (a frame). * In HTML the tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the tag must be properly closed.
Specifies whether or not to display a frame border
&value_boolean;
A URL to a long description of the frame contents
Defines the top and bottom margins of the frame
Defines the left and right margins of the iframe
Specifies a unique name of the iframe (to use in scripts)
When set to noresize the user cannot resize the frame
Define scroll bars
The URL of the document to show in the frame
&core;

The frameset element defines a frameset. It is used to organize multiple windows (frames)
Defines the number and size of columns in a frameset
Defines the number and size of rows in a frameset
&core;

Displays text for browsers that do not handle frames. The noframes element goes inside the frameset element.
&core; ⟨
